description.narrative: By the end of 2016, national and sub-national capacity is strengthened to plan and budget for inclusive social policies and interventions to reduce child vulnerability, which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Children In Urban Settings / Local Governance, Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews, Economic And Social Policy General, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Public Finance And Local Governance, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Evidence-based social policies and legislation, including pro-child budgeting principles, are in place and implemented for the equitable fulfilment of child rights
